oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Nashville Cats program - Bob Moore - 2007-02-17
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Interview program on the life and career to date of Bob Moore from the Ford Theater at the Country Music Hall of Fame and Museum on February 17, 2007
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Bob Moore;
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Includes selected audio excerpts and audio from video. Includes questions from the audience. Hosted by Bill Lloyd. Opening comments by Ali Tonn. Subjects include; Growing up in East Nashville -- Shining shoes outside the Ryman Auditorium -- Working on WSIX radio with Goober and the Kentuckians at ten years old -- First recording session -- Working tent shows with Jam Up and Honey at 14 years old -- Working with Paul Howard's band and recording in Cincinnati -- Working with Little Jimmie Dickens at 18 years old -- Working with Flatt and Scruggs and Eddy Arnold - Red Foley, Grady Martin and working the Ozark Jubilee TV show in Springfield, Missouri -- The effect of rockabilly music and playing that type of music -- Working with Owen Bradley's dance band in Nashville and Bradley's influence on him -- Making a deal with Owen to play all of his recording sessions -- Working with engineer Bill Porter -- Working with Elvis Presley -- Working with Roy Orbison and Monument records --

Recording the song Mexico and the Bob Moore Orchestra -- Experimenting with Bill Porter in RCA studios during Sunday open house sessions -- Recording at the Newport jazz festival -- Story about Hank Garland playing with New York jazz musicians -- Working on demonstration recordings today compared to years ago -- Working on the road with Jerry Lee Lewis -- Comparisons with an upright bass to an electric bass -- Working with Harold Bradley and the tic tac bass -- Playing for musicians versus on recordings for the public -- Producing albums -- Recognizing good songs -- closing comments.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Moore, Bob, 1932-; Country Music Hall of Fame & Museum (Nashville, Tenn.);
